Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function `clean_column`:

```python
def clean_column(col):
    col = col.lower().strip()
    col = col.replace(" ", "_").replace("-", "_")
    return col
```

This function works by converting the column name to lowercase using `lower()`, removing any leading or trailing whitespace with `strip()` and replacing spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace()` method. Note that this will replace all occurrences of spaces and hyphens in the string, not just the first one as you mentioned in your question.
